attributes.action: To stop companys penalizing the poor for not paying by Direct Debit.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
BT makes over £50 Million a year from their poor customers, because they cannot pay by Direct Debit. They charge them £4.50 for a processing fee making them at least £4.00 profit.
They charge £7.50 for late payments making more millions.Living on a low income you have to juggle payments which means payments can be late.
Why are these companys allowed to make profits from peoples poverty driving them further into poverty. It's a disgrace.
